arabic: إِنَّمَا الْأَعْمَالُ بِالنِّيَّاتِ وَإِنَّمَا لِكُلِّ امْرِئٍ مَّا نَوَىٰ
translation: Actions are judged by intentions, and everyone will be rewarded according to what they intended.
explanation: The value of an action depends on the intention behind it. Sincere intentions are the foundation of accepted deeds.

arabic: طَلَبُ الْعِلْمِ فَرِيضَةٌ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ مُسْلِمٍ
translation: Seeking knowledge is an obligation upon every Muslim.
explanation: Knowledge is essential for living a righteous life and fulfilling Islamic duties correctly.

translation: The best of you are those who learn the Qur'an and teach it.
explanation: Learning and teaching the Qur'an is among the most virtuous deeds.

arabic: الْمُؤْمِنُ الْقَوِيُّ خَيْرٌ وَأَحَبُّ إِلَى اللَّهِ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِ الضَّعِيفِ وَفِي كُلٍّ خَيْرٌ
translation: The strong believer is better and more beloved to Allah than the weak believer, while there is good in both.
explanation: Strength—spiritual, physical, and emotional—is praiseworthy when used for good.

translation: I have been sent to perfect good character.
explanation: The Prophet ﷺ's mission included refining people's morals and ethics.

arabic: مَنْ لَا يَرْحَمُ النَّاسَ لَا يَرْحَمُهُ اللَّهُ
translation: Whoever does not show mercy to people, Allah will not show mercy to him.
explanation: Compassion toward others earns Allah's mercy for oneself.
Giving in charity brings blessings and does not reduce your wealth.
Prioritizing prayer over comfort reflects the believer's devotion.
Offering honest, well-intended advice is a key part of Islam.

arabic: لَا يُؤْمِنُ أَحَدُكُمْ حَتَّى يُحِبَّ لِأَخِيهِ مَا يُحِبُّ لِنَفْسِهِ
translation: None of you truly believes until he loves for his brother what he loves for himself.
explanation: True faith requires wishing good for others as you do for yourself.
